    Compute Difference in Means, Standard Error, and Confidence Intervals Between Two Groups

    compute_difference_means.Rd

    This function calculates the difference in means, the standard error of the difference, and the 95 as a list that includes the mean (theta) and the standard error (std.error) of the group. The result is formatted for easy use with `glue::glue` in Quarto documents etc

    Usage

    compute_difference_means(group1, group2)

    Arguments

    group1

    A list containing the mean and standard error of group 1. Expected structure: list(vals = list(theta = x, std.error = y)).

    group2

    A list containing the mean and standard error of group 2. Expected structure: list(vals = list(theta = x, std.error = y)).

    Value

    A data frame with columns `mean_difference`, `std_error`, `conf_low`, and `conf_high`, each rounded to 4 decimal places. Suitable for direct use in reporting.

    Examples

    group1 <- list(vals = list(theta = 100, std.error = 10))
group2 <- list(vals = list(theta = 90, std.error = 5))
result <- compute_difference_means(group1, group2)
glue::glue("The difference in means is {result$mean_difference} with a 95% CI of [{result$conf_low}, {result$conf_high}].")
#> The difference in means is 10 with a 95% CI of [-11.9135, 31.9135].
